Episodes.Title: The Chaperone
Episodes.Plot: Jerry gets a date with Miss Rhode Island, a Miss America contestant; when they need a chaperone Kramer is available. On the date, Kramer gives her advice and becomes her personal coach. Elaine tries to get a job at Doubleday, filling in the shoes once filled by Jackie Onassis; instead she gets a job being the personal assistant of a top executive who likes white socks. Meanwhile, George decides that the Yankees need to change their uniforms from polyester to cotton.
Episodes.Writer: Larry David, Bill Masters, Bob Shaw
Episodes.GuestStars: Ian Abercrombie, Gail Strickland, Marguerite MacIntyre, Danny Tartabull, Buck Showalter

Episodes.Title: The Big Salad
Episodes.Plot: Elaine's boss wants a special mechanical pencil, so Elaine tries to get one from a stationary store where the clerk has a thing for her. George and his girlfriend pick up a "big salad" for Elaine, that his girlfriend gives to Elaine and she thanks her. Later, George points out that he bought the "big salad." Jerry discovers that his current girlfriend once dated Newman, who broke off his relationship with her. Kramer plays golf with an ex-ball player who breaks a rule of golf, they have a fight,
Episodes.GuestStars: Lauren Bowles, Wayne Knight, Michelle Forbes, Jerry Levine, Marita Geraghty, Barry Nolan, Dean Hallo

Episodes.Title: The Pledge Drive

Elaine's boss eats his Snickers bar with a knife and fork and idea that soon catches on. George thinks a waitress gave him the finger. Jerry gets caught throwing away a thank you card. Episodes.GuestStars: Lauren Bowles, Len Lesser, Ian Abercrombie, Kelly Coffield, Billye Ree Wallace, Brian Reddy, Danny Tartabull, Tom Wright, James Reynolds, F.J. Rio, Thom Vernon, Rebecca Staab

Episodes.Title: The Chinese Woman
Episodes.Plot: Jerry and Elaine see George's father with a man with a cape but don't say hello. Jerry discovers a Chinese woman on George's phone line after the wires get crossed and he gets a date with her. Kramer gets worried about his sperm count, so he goes to a fertility clinic and then makes a change in his choice of undergarments. Elaine ruins her friend Noreen's latest romance with a long talker. Episodes.GuestStars: Larry David, Jerry Stiller, Estelle Harris, Kelly Coffield, Angela Dohrmann, William Utay, Lucy Lin, Jack Tracy

Episodes.Title: The Couch
Episodes.Plot: Elaine begins to date the guy who delivers Jerry's new couch. Kramer plans to start the pizza business he thought of back in "Male Unbonding" with Poppie. George joins a book club, but tries to rent the movie so he can bluff his way through the meeting. Jerry and Elaine's discussion of the abortion issue causes trouble for Poppie, Elaine's relationship & Jerry's new couch. George spends the evening with the family that has rented the film.

Episodes.Title: The Gymnast
Episodes.Plot: George and Kramer convince Jerry he'll be missing out on something if he stops dating a Romanian Olympic gymnast. Jerry and Kramer find out about one of George's bathroom habits. Kramer must pass a kidney stone. The mother of George's girlfriend sees him eat something out of a trash bin, later cleaning a windshield & one of his bathroom habits. Elaine's boss becomes obsessed with finding the image in a 3-D painting, so he sends her to represent him in a huge merger deal.

Episodes.Title: The Soup
Episodes.Plot: Elaine brings over a man she met in England and he turns out to be a real bounder. Jerry accepts an Armani suit from an obnoxious comedian, the only condition, he must treat him to a meal at a restaurant; however, what makes up a meal. George goes for a walk with a waitress from Monk's and manure in the path sums up his relationship with her. After his kidney stone, Kramer decides to eat only fresh foods.
Episodes.GuestStars: Lawrence Mandley, Steve Hytner, Tracy Kolis, Daniel Gerroll, Linda Wallem, Michael Kaplan

Episodes.Title: The Mom & Pop Store
Episodes.Plot: A salesman convinces George to buy a convertible once owned by "Jon Voight." Kramer tries to save a small shoe-repair business, but his good intentions affect Jerry in a big way. Elaine wins tickets for Mr. Pitt, who's always wanted to participate in the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

Elaine is put on a "blacklist" for Chinese food delivery and finds out her boyfriend is a Communist. George convinces his girlfriend to get her male roommate to move out, that he soon regrets. Kramer takes playing a game of Risk against Newman seriously. Episodes.Title: The Beard
Episodes.Plot: Elaine tries to convert a gay man to heterosexuality. George, who's now wearing his toupee, discovers that the woman Kramer has set him up with, is bald. Kramer gives a homeless man some Chinese food and begins standing in police lineups for $50 a lineup. Jerry begins to date a cop, but she wants him to take a lie detector test, she thinks he is lying about NOT watching Melrose Place.

Episodes.Title: The Doorman
Episodes.Plot: The doorman in Mr. Pitt's building causes trouble for Jerry who was only trying to be nice. Kramer robs George on the street for some German tourists. George's father is living with him and when he removes his shirt, George and Kramer see that he has breasts. So, Kramer develops a new undergarment for males ("The Bro" or "The Manssiere") that will alleviate this problem. Jerry offers his soiled couch to replace the one that was stolen while he was "on duty."

Episodes.Title: The Jimmy

Episodes.Title: The Understudy
Episodes.Plot: George and Jerry are suspected by the cast and Kramer of deliberately injuring Bette Midler during a softball game, giving Jerry's girlfriend, Bette's understudy, a chance to perform. Kramer becomes Bette's personal assistant. Elaine gets George's father to translate for her when she suspects that her manicurist has made some obvious snide remarks in a foreign tongue. While crying about losing her manicurists, Elaine meets the owner of a catalog, J. Peterman, and gets herself a new job.
